StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [SaveRecruiterHistory]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
( @RecruiterHistoryID uniqueiden..er, @RecruiterID uniqueiden..er, @OrgUnitID int, @BilletID int, @BilletBeginDate date.me, @BilletEndDate date.me, @UpdatedByUser uniqueiden..er ) AS BEGIN
BEGIN TRANSACTION
IF EXISTS(SELECT RecruiterHistoryID FROM [dbo].[RecruiterHistory] WHERE [RecruiterHistoryID] = @RecruiterHistoryID) BEGIN UPDATE [dbo].[RecruiterHistory] SET [RecruiterID] = @RecruiterID, [OrgUnitID] = @OrgUnitID, [BilletID] = @BilletID, [BilletBeginDate] = @BilletBeginDate, [BilletEndDate] = @BilletEndDate, [UpdatedByUser] = @UpdatedByUser, [DateUpdated] = GETDATE() WHERE [RecruiterHistoryID] = @RecruiterHistoryID END ELSE BEGIN INSERT INTO [dbo].[RecruiterHistory] ( [RecruiterHistoryID], [RecruiterID], [OrgUnitID], [BilletID], [BilletBeginDate], [BilletEndDate], [UpdatedByUser], [DateUpdated] ) VALUES ( @RecruiterHistoryID, @RecruiterID, @OrgUnitID, @BilletID, @BilletBeginDate, @BilletEndDate, @UpdatedByUser, GETDATE() )
END
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully. COMMIT TRANSACTION END
